isInteger

public static boolean isInteger(java.lang.String sInput)
Determines if the string passed is a valid representation of a whole number. Internally tried to convert to a long, if successful returns true. USeful for checking URL parameters to see if they are valid whole numbers.

Returns:
true if the input is a valid long eg "32998"

getMIMELineValue

public static java.lang.String getMIMELineValue(java.lang.String szLine,
                                                java.lang.String szName)
Gets a value from a line of text from a mime header, ie name="xxx" will return "xxx". Just pass the name (szName) of the item you want, not the entire token, ie "name"

Returns:
null if the item does not exist

                                           java.lang.String sSeperator)
Splits a delimited String into a Vector of individual components example: Vector v = puakma.util.Util.splitString("NSW,VIC,QLD", ",");

Returns:
null if either of the inputs are null

splitString

public static java.util.ArrayList splitString(java.lang.String sInput,
                                              char cChar)
Splits a delimited String into a ArrayList of individual components. This verison uses an arraylist and a single char, so is a little faster. example: ArrayList a = puakma.util.Util.splitString("NSW,VIC,QLD", ',');

Returns:
null if either of the inputs are null

formatDate

public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date dtFormat,
                                          java.lang.String szFormatString,
                                          java.util.Locale lo,
                                          java.util.TimeZone tz)
Convert a date into a formatted String. This will automatically do the timezone conversion too. To convert to a GMT string: puakma.util.Util.formatDate(new java.util.Date(), "EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss z", Locale.UK, TimeZone.getTimeZone("GMT"));

Returns:
the string representation of the date of "" if the date could not be converted

objectArrayToStringArray

public static java.lang.String[] objectArrayToStringArray(java.lang.Object[] array)

getMXAddress

public static java.lang.String getMXAddress(java.lang.String sMXHost)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Gets the MX address for a given host. For round-robin DNS, this retrieves only the first entry. We rely on the DNS server to supply its prefered choice. Will return the correct address or throw an exception

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getHTTPContent

public static byte[] getHTTPContent(java.io.BufferedReader br,
                                    int iContentLength,
                                    int iMaxSize)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Reads a http response, http 1.0 and "Transfer-Encoding: chunked" reply into a byte buffer up to iMaxSize set iContentLength to -1 if unknown or chunked/http 1.0

Returns:
null if the iMaxSize was exceeded, set iMaxSize to -1 for no limit
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                                   int iRead)
Convert a char array into a byte array

charArrayToByteArray

public static byte[] charArrayToByteArray(char[] charBuf)
Converts a character array (double byte chars) to a byte array. In terms of internationalisation, this chops characters so should be used with care.

Returns:
the converted byte array, or null if the input is null

enforceDocumentRoot

public static java.lang.String enforceDocumentRoot(java.lang.String requested_path)
This method makes sure that the client is only allowed files that reside within the document root directory
